nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
## 3. Identifying Questions using AI
[Read more about Question & Answer Chain]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

Using the power of LLMs, we're able to extract the RFP questionnaire regardless of original formatting or layout. This allows AutoRFP to handle a wide range of RFPs without requiring explicit extraction rules for edge cases.

Additionally, We'll use the Input List Output Parser to return a list of questions for further processing.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
## 4. Generating Question & Answer Pairs with AI
[Read more about using OpenAI Assistants in n8n]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

By preparing an OpenAI Assistant with marketing material and sales documents about our company and business, we are able to use AI to answer RFP questions with the accurate and relevant context. Potentially allowing sales teams to increase the number of RFPs they can reply to.

This portion of the workflow loops through and answers each question individually for better answers. We can record the Question and Answer pairings to the RFP response document we created earlier.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: OpenAI Chat Model
nodes.notes: This lmChatOpenAi node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
## Try It Out!

**This workflow does the following:**
* Receives a RFP document via webhook
* Creates a new RFP response document via Google Docs
* Uses LLMs to extract the questions from the RFP document into a questions list
* Loops through each question and uses an OpenAI Assistant to generate an answer. Saving each answer into the response document.
* Once complete, sends a gmail and slack notification to the team.


ðŸ“ƒ**Example Documents**
To run this workflow, you'll need to following 2 documents:
* [RFP Document]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
* [Example Company Document]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

### Need Help?
Join the [Discord]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} or ask in the [Forum]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

Happy Hacking!

nodes.name: Sticky Note7

parameters.content:
ðŸš¨**Required**
You'll need to create an OpenAI Assistant to use this workflow.
* Sign up for [OpenAI Dashboard]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} if you haven't already.
* Create an [OpenAI Assistant]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
* Upload the [example company doc]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} to the assistant.

The assistant will use the company doc to answer the questions.

nodes.name: Extract Questions From RFP

parameters.text:
=You have been given a RFP document as part of a tender process of a buyer. Please extract all questions intended for the supplier. You must ensure the questions extracted are exactly has they are written in the RFP document.

<RFP>{{ $('Get RFP Data').item.json.text }}<RFP>

nodes.notes: This chainLlm node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note9

parameters.content:
### Example Webhook Request
curl --location 'https://<n8n_webhook_url>' \
--form 'id="RFP001"' \
--form 'title="BlueChip Travel and StarBus Web Services"' \
--form 'reply_to="jim@example.com"' \
--form 'data=@"k9pnbALxX/RFP Questionnaire.pdf"'

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Extractfromfile Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Extractfromfile Workflow. This workflow integrates 13 different services: webhook, stickyNote, outputParserItemList, splitInBatches, chainLlm. It contains 32 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 32
- **Node Types**: 13
- **Error Handling**: âœ… Implemented
- **Security**: âœ… Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: âœ… Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Get RFP Data**: extractFromFile
- **Item List Output Parser**: outputParserItemList
- **For Each Question...**: splitInBatches
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Set Variables**: set
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Create new RFP Response Document**: googleDocs
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note3**: stickyNote
- **OpenAI Chat Model**: lmChatOpenAi
- ... and 22 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
